name: 3,5-bis(trifluoromethyl)phenylacetic acid
Reason: 3,5-Bis(trifluoromethyl)phenylacetic acid has a melting point influenced by functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The phenyl group contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +20°C per group, totaling +40°C. The carboxy group introduces polar interactions, contributing approximately +30°C. The presence of two additional phenyl groups can significantly increase the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +40°C per group, totaling +80°C.
